org.eclipse.wst.xsl.debugger
Class DebugRunner

java.lang.Object
  org.eclipse.wst.xsl.debugger.DebugRunner

public class DebugRunner
extends java.lang.Object

The entry point to the debug process which is responsible for configuring a debugger and then communicating with the Eclipse process via sockets using a common set of commands.

  • instantiates an implementation of IXSLDebugger
  • configures the debugger with the transformation pipeline
  • starts the debugger in a separate thread
  • the main thread is then used to listen to incoming requests and call the appropriate debugger methods

Author:
Doug Satchwell

Create a new instance of this using the supplied readers and writers.

Parameters:
requestIn - the reader for reading incoming requests
requestOut - the writer for acknowledging requests
eventOut - the writer for publishing debug events

DebugRunner

public DebugRunner(int requestPort,
                   int eventPort)
            throws java.io.IOException
Create a new instance of this given a request port and an event port.

Parameters:
requestPort - the port to listen to requests and send acknowledgements
eventPort - the port for publishing debug events
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem opening a socket
Method Detail

loop

public void loop(IXSLDebugger debugger)
          throws TransformationException
This method starts the given debugger in its own thread, and blocks while waiting for incoming requests from the request port, until there are no more requests.

Parameters:
debugger - the debugger to start in a thread
Throws:
TransformationException - if a problem occurred while transforming

dispose

public void dispose()
Dispose of this - close all open sockets.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Expected arguments:

  2. the file name of the XML launch configuration file
  3. the URL of the source document
  4. the file of the output document
  5. not used (anything)
  6. the class name of the IXSLDebugger instance
  7. the port used for requests
  8. the port used for debug events
